show.html.erb

Path: app/views/model_browser/show.html.erb
Last Update: Wed Jul 16 11:45:02 +0200 2008

<%

begin

This view renders the detail-display of one model-object‘s instance. It is called by the show-action of the model-object‘s controller.

It displays the object‘s attributes using the partial +model_browser/details+ and reflects all the model-objects associations to render an index of the associated objects using the partial +model_brower/index+ for each association, which target-set is not empty.

The calling controller must provide the following information:

@model_instance:the model-object to display

end

%>

<%= render :partial => "model_browser/details", :locals => { 

  :heading_tag => :h1,
  :object_class => @model_instance.class,
  :object => @model_instance,
  :only => @model_instance.class.preferred_detail_attributes

} %>

<% @model_instance.class.reflect_on_all_associations.each do |association| 

  target = @model_instance.method(association.name).call
  next if target.nil?
  if association.macro == :has_one || association.macro == :belongs_to
    entries = [ target ]
  else
    entries = target
  end
  next if entries.empty?

%> 

  <%= render :partial => "model_browser/index", :locals => {
      :heading_tag => :h2,
      :association_type => association.macro.to_s,
      :entry_class => entries[0].class,
      :entries => entries
  } %>

<% end %>

[Validate]
